intro: Silene saxifraga subsp. parnassica, commonly known as the Parnassian campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Alps and surrounding mountain ranges. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in racemes. The plant thrives in rocky and alpine habitats, often growing on slopes and in crevices where the soil is thin. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Silene saxifraga subsp. parnassica is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy blooms and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
